MajorClaims.MC1: parents should be more worried about their children's attitudes to the 'cult of celebrity'

Claims.C1: children may see that this behavior is inexcusable
Claims.C2: too much news coverage to famous people seems to have a negative influence on the choice of children of their future professions

Premises.P1: celebrities who received attention for overuse of drugs or alcohol are likely to get public disgrace
Premises.P2: Celebrity scandals and gossips can quickly reach the public which perceive it very negatively
Premises.P3: As recent surveys showed, inspired by the fame and wealth, children now prefer more to become an actor/actress or a sports star than it was in the past
Premises.P4: Many schools for preparation of so-called stars and various advertisements about famous people may mislead with the fact that this profession is highly required and easy reachable
Premises.P5: This may confuse children who should not choose their future job because of the influence of the mass media, but from the basis of their own interests
Premises.P6: Fame is a great responsibility for public people as their admirers are very sensitive to any acts of their idols
